parameters:
You all, the exiles, attempting to escape from this island
is a crime punishable by death. That is the law of this
island. Tomorrow morning, each of you will be beheaded. Do
you understand?

I'm sorry... everyone... It's my fault for believing in
false information...

The ones at fault are the leaders of the exiles. Kokuyou
Tengu-san, you did nothing wrong.

There's no use in regretting now. We have to stay
positive...

Before we escape from the island, we need to break out of
this prison cell. Can you do it, Karin-san? You're an expert
thief, aren't you?

We can't proceed without breaking out of this cell. If you
were a master thief, surely you have the skills to pick
locks?

Uh...! I was... that is... more of a burglar type of thief,
so I'm not really good with locks...

...I'm sorry. If I hadn't said I wanted to escape from the
island, this wouldn't have happened...

Karin-san, there's no need for you to apologize. This was a
decision made by all of us here.

Can't be helped. Good things come to those who wait. Let's
make as much trouble as we can when they take us to the
execution ground.

...(Even if we manage to escape from the officials, there's
no way off this island. Without a ship capable of escape,
there's nothing we can do...)

--With feelings of anxiety suppressed, each of them fell
asleep...

(The sun has risen and it's getting brighter around... Is it
morning already...)
Don't worry, Kachou-san. I will protect you...

Tsk tsk... To think they went to the hidden port at Touro
Pass.

Keep your voices down. The officials will notice and come
here. So, was there a ship at the hidden port?

Yes, there was one, but it was just a tub boat... Not
something that could carry everyone and escape from the
island...

Haha. That was just a decoy. The real ship certainly exists.
A fine sailing ship capable of overcoming the rough seas and
returning to Edo.

It was secretly built at that hidden port over many decades.
However, its time came and went without the ship ever being
used... The man who built it was a warlord who had been
exiled to this island.

Exactly. The tub boat was just a decoy. It was there to
reassure any officials who found it that escape was
impossible with such a boat. However, it seems that the
leaders of the exiles were falsely using it as if there was
an escape ship...

Hmm...! So there was indeed a ship capable of escape, as
rumored. Those exile leaders...

Village Chief-san, where is this real ship you speak of?
There was only a tub boat at the hidden port...

There's a secret room deep within the port. Look for a
[Doll] in a corner of the hidden port. That's your clue.

A doll...? So that's the clue to the secret room.
Understood.

Now, we can't talk for long or the officials will notice.
Hurry and escape from this cell.
--The Village Chief used a key to unlock the door!
What?! You're going to help us escape from the cell?

I am the Village Chief of Mujou Island, am I not? Of course,
I have copies of all the keys to the cells on the island.
Now, escape quickly.

If you help us escape, won't you get caught too, even if you
are the Village Chief?

Why are you helping us so much? You're the Village Chief of
Mujou Island, aren't you? It's like you're taking the side
of us exiles...

You see, I am the great-great-grandson of a warlord who was
exiled to this island a hundred years ago.
----!! The Village Chief is also a descendant of exiles...!?

That's right. I too wish to see the dream of escaping this
island, a dream my exiled ancestor could not fulfill. I want
to see that unused sailing ship set sail.

Now, head north again through Tohru Pass and go to the
hidden port. The officials will notice soon. Hurry!

Understood, Village Chief-san! We will definitely fulfill
your will and the unachieved dream of your ancestor!

Hmm. Thank you. Take this as a parting gift. Make sure you
return safely to Edo.
